sentences.en: A detailed guide to Regimental Chapel is available from the bookstall.
sentences.cn: 您可以在教堂的书店里找到关于国王直属团礼拜堂的更详细的资料.

sentences.en: Are you reading the book you picked up at the bookstall this morning?
sentences.cn: 你在读今天早上在书摊上买的那本书吗?

sentences.en: As I was looking through some books on a secondhand bookstall , I dropped on just what I wanted.
sentences.cn: 当我在旧书摊浏览书籍时, 我意外地找到了我所需要的书.

sentences.en: I bought Yuefei's Complete Biography in the bookstall.
sentences.cn: 我在书摊儿上买了一本《岳飞全传》.

sentences.en: Perhaps you might chance on the dictionary at some old bookstall.
sentences.cn: 或许你会碰巧在旧书摊上买到这本辞典.

sentences.en: Perhaps you might chance upon the dictionary at some old bookstall.
sentences.cn: 或许你会在旧书摊上偶然发现这本字典.

sentences.en: She will never come into the bookstall again.
sentences.cn: 她不会再来这个报摊了.

sentences.en: There was still half an hour left in which to drive to the station, buy the last weeklies at the bookstall with the air of seasoned travellers.
sentences.cn: 还有半小时的光景，供他们坐车到火车站，摆出见过世面的旅客的样干，在车站的书摊上买几份近期周刊。

sentences.en: Will newsprint not be available in a few years time, also magazines at the bookstall?
sentences.cn: 新闻纸将不能在数年之后, 又在书摊杂志?

sentences.en: You can buy a guidebook or a tourist map. The bookstall is just over there.
sentences.cn: 你可以买本导游手册或旅游图. 报亭就在那边.

trans.tran_cn: <英>（火车站等处的）书报摊，书亭，（临时的） 书摊
trans.tran_en: a small shop that has an open front and sells books and magazines, often at a railway station
